p: Concerning RHDV GI.1, from 1988 we carried out a campaign of frequent visits, necropsies and sample collection for laboratory analysis, where the O type human blood agglutination test [ 38] was carried out. When the RHDV GI.2 epidemics occurred in 2011â€“2013, laboratory diagnosis consisted of RT-PCR and sequencing similar to that described in [ 31, 39] and when it became available with a rapid field analytical test kit (Cer Test Biotec, Zaragoza, Spain). We also necropsied adults, young rabbits and weaned rabbits (>35 days old), and carried out histopathologic studies of rabbits under 25 days old. Images related to RHD are available on [ 40].
